to have a relationship: to see each other with the intent of marriage
someone who can officiate a marriage
to arrange a meeting between families
to prepare a dowry (from brides family to grooms family)
to prepare wedding gifts (exchange between bride and groom)
to send a box of wedding gifts (from the grooms family to the bride)
to pay respect to the groom's family (parents throw jujubes and chesnuts which represent children at the bride and she has to catch them with her skirt to wish her to have many children)
to not have a dowry (~은 안 하다)
to receive permission to get married
to put a red spot on the bride's forehead
to put two red spots on the bride's cheeks
by accident, by chance (우연히 다시 마나다)
